abstract: Wesley Golby, hedge fund manager who signed contract to purchase Norman Mailer's Brooklyn Heights apartment, is suing to get out of the purchase; claims that Mailer estate failed to provide evidence to back up assurances that renovations done in 1960s were legal and in accordance with zoning laws and building codes.
snippet: A man is suing to get out of a purchase because he says Norman Mailer’s estate has not backed up assurances that unusual renovations met legal requirements.
lead_paragraph: A man is suing to get out of a purchase because he says Norman Mailer’s estate has not backed up assurances that unusual renovations met legal requirements.

headline.main: True to Mailer’s Life, a Brawl Over the Sale of His Brooklyn Heights Apartment
headline.print_headline: True to Mailer’s Life, a Brawl Over the Sale of His Brooklyn Heights Apartment
headline.seo: Norman Mailer’s Estate Is Sued Over Apartment’s Sale
